description: Snowshoe through a coastal rainforest complete with old-growth cedars and extensive frozen marshlands. The trail has some steep sections at the beginning and end. You may encounter backcountry skiers on this route, so use caution on those steep sections
directions: Callaghan country - see the attached GPS data (downloadable), and / or click 'Expand +' on the right of the map, then click to see roadmap or terrain for more explicit directions.  Also, 'get directions' on the above tab will give you step by step directions based on the gps data.  Callaghan country is the area just south of Whistler used for XC skiing at the 2010 Olympics and it's a high alpine plateau you can drive up to.  As approaching Whistler, keep an eye  out on the left for the signs to Callaghan country.
title: Finger Lakes
